trans-unit.source: Provides a MarginsConverter for <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref>.
The MarginsConverter class provides methods that can convert a string to a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins>.
> [!NOTE] > You should never access a type converter directly.
Instead, call the appropriate converter by using <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
For more information on printing, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.MarginsConverter"></xref> class.
Returns whether this converter can convert an object of the specified source type to the native type of the converter using the specified context.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type from which you want to convert.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if an object can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type to which you want to convert.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Converts the specified object to the converter's native type.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> that provides the language to convert to.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted value.
value does not contain values for all four margins.
For example, "100,100,100,100" specifies 1 inch for the left, right, top, and bottom margins.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the given value object to the specified destination type using the specified context and arguments.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> that provides the language to convert to.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
The <xref:System.Type> to which to convert the value.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted value.
destinationType is .
The conversion cannot be performed.
Creates an <xref:System.Object> given a set of property values for the object.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
An <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of new property values.
An <xref:System.Object> representing the specified <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary>, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the object cannot be created.
propertyValues is .
Returns whether changing a value on this object requires a call to the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.MarginsConverter.CreateInstance*> method to create a new value, using the specified context.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if changing a property on this object requires a call to <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.MarginsConverter.CreateInstance*> to create a new value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This method always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
